SecurityMeasures: HTTP 403 Forbidden error for certain directories

Steps.Description: Discover the existence of Bazaar repository folder

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that the target may have a Bazaar repository folder due to the owner's interest in Canonical products.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker tries to access the '.bzr' directory on the target website.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker receives an HTTP 403 Forbidden error, indicating the presence of the directory.

Steps.Description: Retrieve the last revision of the Bazaar repository

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the last revision of the Bazaar repository may contain sensitive information or credentials.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker accesses the 'last-revision' file within the '.bzr/branch' directory.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker obtains the last revision number 'bzr_lover-20181206184825-790ppqxy6l69f581'.

Steps.Description: Create a local Bazaar repository and download necessary files

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to recreate the website files by crafting a similar '.bzr' directory.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker creates a local Bazaar repository, adds a file, commits the changes, and then removes the file.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker creates the necessary directory structure for the '.bzr' folder and deletes the added file.

Steps.Description: Download missing files from the target's Bazaar repository

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker assumes that downloading missing files from the target's Bazaar repository will allow them to recreate the website files.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker downloads the missing files from the target's '.bzr/repository' directory using the 'wget' command.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully obtains the missing files: indices and packs.

Steps.Description: Check the status of the local repository

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to verify the success of the previous steps and identify any missing files.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses the 'bzr status' command to check the status of the local repository.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker identifies the missing file 'index.php'.

Steps.Description: Revert the missing file in the local repository

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that reverting the missing file will recreate the website's index.php file.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses the 'bzr revert' command to recreate the 'index.php' file.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully reverts the missing file, recreating the website's index.php file.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker anticipates that the flag may be stored in the index
